fr:mainmatter.fr:p: Let (a,b)\colon R\rightarrowtail A \times A be a relation in a cartesian category. (a,b) is said to be symmetric if it contains the twisted relation (b,a)\colon R\rightarrowtail A \times A, i.e., if there is a morphism \sigma \colon R\to R such that a\sigma = b and b\sigma = a.
Let (a,b)\colon R\rightarrowtail A \times A be a relation in a cartesian category. (a,b) is said to be an equivalence relation if it is reflexive, symmetric, and transitive.
